summary.blockquote: [!NOTE] This structure is supported by the Direct3D 11.2 runtime, which is available on Windows 8.1 and later operating systems.
summary.para: Describes Direct3D 11.2 feature options in the current graphics driver.

member.name: D3D11_FEATURE_DATA_D3D11_OPTIONS1.TiledResourcesTier
member.summary: Specifies whether the hardware and driver support tiled resources. The runtime sets this member to a -typed value that indicates if the hardware and driver support tiled resources and at what tier level.

member.name: D3D11_FEATURE_DATA_D3D11_OPTIONS1.MinMaxFiltering
member.summary: Specifies whether the hardware and driver support the filtering options () of comparing the result to the minimum or maximum value during texture sampling. The runtime sets this member to TRUE if the hardware and driver support these filtering options.

member.name: D3D11_FEATURE_DATA_D3D11_OPTIONS1.ClearViewAlsoSupportsDepthOnlyFormats
member.summary: Specifies whether the hardware and driver also support the method on depth formats. For info about valid depth formats, see .

member.name: D3D11_FEATURE_DATA_D3D11_OPTIONS1.MapOnDefaultBuffers
member.summary: Specifies support for creating resources that can be passed to the and methods. This means that the CPUAccessFlags member of the structure may be set with the desired elements when the Usage member of D3D11_BUFFER_DESC is set to D3D11_USAGE_DEFAULT. The runtime sets this member to TRUE if the hardware is capable of at least D3D_FEATURE_LEVEL_11_0 and the graphics device driver supports mappable default buffers.
